input_args.passage: 'Georges-Henri Bousquet - Wikipedia | Georges-Henri Bousquet (21 June 1900, Meudon – 23 January 1978, Latresne) was a 20th-century French jurist, economist and Islamologist. He was a professor of law at the Faculty of Law of the University of Algiers where he was a specialist in the sociology of North Africa (Berbers, Islam)., 20th-century French jurist, economist and Islamologist\nGeorges-Henri Bousquet - Wikipedia | He is also known for his translation work of the great Muslim authors, Al-Ghazali, a theologian who died in 1111 and Tunisian historian Ibn Khaldun (1332–1406)., Ibn Khaldun'
input_args.claim: 'From the context, we learn that Georges-Henri Bousquet was known for his translation work of various Muslim authors.'
